extends Object

OTP base provider.

Method Detail

close

public void close()
           throws IOException
Closes any open key (key handle). This method should only be necessary to call for keys that support PIN caching.

Throws:
IOException

generate

public String generate()
                throws IOException
Returns the next OTP value. For event-based OTP prividers the counter value is updated, while time-based OTP providers simply return the value associated with the current time.

Throws:
IOException

generate

public String generate(String challenge)
                throws IOException
Returns the OTP value for a challenge-response OTP provider instance.

Throws:
IOException

                       throws IOException
Returns the number of digits needed for a challenge-response-based OTP provider instance.

Throws:
IOException

             throws IOException
Returns the time cycle in seconds for a time-based OTP provider instance.
